The sun is beginning to set, and you know you should be getting back to camp soon, but you don't want to leave r_c's side yet.

intro_text: You, r_c and o_c1 are strolling along the riverbank. Suddenly, a stone catches your eye. The colour reminds you of o_c1's eyes, and you consider showing it to the two.

You each keep someone else's matching rock with you when you head back to camp, and you sleep a little better that night with it by your nest.

intro_text: o_c1 and r_c are settling down for an afternoon nap together. It looks cosy-- you wonder if they'd let you join them.

intro_text: You're bored around camp, and you notice that r_c and o_c1 are both in camp as well, looking equally bored. The flowers have bloomed-- you consider asking them both if they'd like to spend some time with you.
decline_text: You decide against it, the fear of rejection too strong to overpower.

success_outcomes.text: You ask both cats if they'd like to hang out with you, and to your delight, they agree! You, r_c and o_c1 settle in a bountiful flower field just outside of camp and decide to make each other some pretty accessories to wear out of the petals.

intro_text: In a rare moment of joy during your punishment, you and r_c are in the camp clearing, rolling around in the sun and laughing together. You think {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} fur is so beautiful when the sun hits it just right, but you think it might be weird to tell them that.

intro_text: Not a lot of cats will spend time with you these days, but r_c is still here. At the edge of camp, you've become a single bundle of fur as r_c licks the top of your head. No one has seen you here yet, but you're worried that, if they do, r_c will get in trouble for being so kind to you.
decline_text: Though you appreciate the comfort, you separate yourself from r_c from about a tail length so that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} won't get in trouble if you're spotted. You're much colder now, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/look/looks} a bit sad.

success_outcomes.text: You can't bring yourself to tear yourself away from {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}. You fall asleep, cradled by r_c, and when you wake up again, it's been several hours and r_c is still here. None of your Clanmates must feel the need to separate you.

You express this want to r_c as you sit together by the edge of camp, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/tell/tells} you that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can help you climb up into a tree for a better view, if you'd like.

fail_outcomes.text: You agree, but as r_c leads you to a tree in the corner of camp, a warrior calls out to you, requesting that you don't go anywhere they can't keep an eye on you. You sigh and follow r_c back into the centre of the camp, where you spend the sunset trying to catch a glimpse of it through the trees.

intro_text: You see r_c and o_c1 lingering by the camp entrance, seemingly preparing to head out. You'd love to join them, but you don't know if they'd be as open to that as they once would be, given what you've done.
decline_text: You decide against it, knowing that their rejection is likely inevitable.

success_outcomes.text: You approach the two, head low, expecting a rejection. However, when you ask if you can join them, they seem glad to have you! Since you're not allowed to leave camp, you, r_c and o_c1 spend some time in the clearing.

fail_outcomes.text: When they see you approaching, r_c and o_c1 quickly stand up and rush out through the camp entrance, knowing you won't be allowed to follow them.

intro_text: While walking with r_c, you notice the small clearing in which you and r_c used to lay in to watch the stars. Blooming with wildflowers and the sun shining on the warm grass, you feel the urge to lay there and enjoy the sunset with r_c once more.
decline_text: You realize you'd rather not lay in a pile of bees and itchy grass, and trot away to find a place that wouldn't make you or r_c itch for an eternity.

success_outcomes.text: r_c accepts and before you know it, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} playfully chasing you through the wildflower fields. Just as the sun sets against the horizon, r_c tackles you into the clearing and rolls, wildflower petals floating through the air in a beautiful arrangement of color. You and r_c share a moment of laughter, enjoying yourself before you have to travel back to c_n.

r_c agrees and hops through the flower field with joyful glee, breaking the seeds from the flowers so they float to the sky. While {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} distracted, you pluck a few flowers from the stems and start to weave the stems together until it forms a circle. Proud of your work, you show it off to r_c as a gift. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/accept/accepts} it with a bunt of heads!

You're left pouting, entering the clearing alone as r_c trots to the Clan.

r_c agrees and follows you into the clearing, stepping over the wildflowers carefully. You hear a fearful yelp from behind and before you know it, r_c is racing off with a few dozen bees following {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tail. You can't help but snicker into your paw at {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} misfortune, but quickly hide your amusement as r_c comes back with a few angry stings.

r_c agrees and follows you into the clearing, stepping over the wildflowers carefully. You hear a fearful yelp from behind and before you know it, r_c is racing out of the field. You hear the familiar buzz of angry bees and run off yourself, the angry creatures redirecting their target onto you. Safe to say it stung to hear your mate's laughter.

intro_text: You watch from across camp as r_c works hard to help set a haunted den up for the kits. You wonder if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} distracted enough to allow for you sneak out of camp to find {PRONOUN/r_c/object} a gift.
decline_text: You dismiss the idea. You shouldn't be distracting {PRONOUN/r_c/object} from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} work, anyway.

success_outcomes.text: When r_k runs up to {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, you take the opportunity and slide out of the camp entrance while {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} head is turned. While you're out, you collect as many sweet things you can find-- some berries, catmint, and even some honeycombs-- and arrange them on a large rhubarb leaf. When you arrive back to camp, dragging the treats behind you, r_c is excited to receive the gift while {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} friends fawn about it behind {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.

You decide to call out to r_c that you'll be leaving to collect some cobwebs for the den's decorations. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/give/gives} you a quick nod before getting back to work, so you head out. You gather some spooky cobwebs while you're out of camp, but make sure to grab a treat for r_c while you're there. You return to camp with the cobwebs and a small bundle of berries, both of which {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/accept/accepts} gratefully.

r_k runs up to r_c, distracting {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, so you take the opportunity and slip out of camp. You're not able to find much, but you manage to snatch a pretty trinket from a display in front of a Twoleg nest. You surprise r_c with it back at camp, who thanks you enthusiastically!

fail_outcomes.text: You stand up to leave, but at the same time, r_k sprints up to you, saying r_c needs your help with the den. You'll have to find the time to get a gift later.

You quickly slip out of camp, grab a bundle of raspberries, and return to camp before anycat can notice you've left. However, when you return to camp, you're told that r_c left to gather some cobwebs for the den decorations. You just give r_m the raspberries instead.

intro_text: You've asked r_c to meet you by the camp entrance. Little {VERB/r_c/do/does} {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} know, you're waiting just outside to give {PRONOUN/r_c/object} a scare!
decline_text: On second thought, you shouldn't contribute to the scariness of the season. When r_c approaches, you give {PRONOUN/r_c/object} a polite nod and invite {PRONOUN/r_c/object} on a normal, jumpscare-less walk.

Good one!

As r_c passes through the camp entrance, you tackle {PRONOUN/r_c/object} with a shout. Caught off-guard, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/slap/slaps} at {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} assailant with frantic paws until {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/realise/realises} it's you. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} playfully {VERB/r_c/shove/shoves} you off and {VERB/r_c/tell/tells} you {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'ll get you back soon before inviting you on a walk.

Apparently, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/weren't/wasn't} in the mood.

You jump out at r_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/near/nears} the entrance, but, apparently, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/weren't/wasn't} quite close enough. A few tail lengths away, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/stand/stands} still and {VERB/r_c/tell/tells} you it was a good attempt.

intro_text: There's a beautiful sight in the sky this afternoon-- a shining ring seems to have formed around the sun! Two cats spring to mind immediately-- r_c and o_c1. They'll want to see this! You wonder if you'll be able to track them down in time to show them.
decline_text: You decide to stay put and enjoy the moment alone. Wherever they are, you're sure they can see it for themselves.

success_outcomes.text: You jump down quickly from your seat in a tree at the edge of camp. You duck your head into dens until you've located the two, gesturing for them to follow you. Soon, all three of you are side by side on a branch, pelts fluffed up together against the cold, enjoying the unique sight.

Turns out, you don't need to fetch them! r_c and o_c1's voices reach your ears, in awe of the phenomenon before them. The three of you lay in the snow and talk about all sorts of things to pass the time, wondering if the rings will ever dissipate. Before then, r_c yawns and claims {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} tired. It's time to travel back to camp.

fail_outcomes.text: You race back into camp from where you'd seen the sight just outside of it. However, as much as you search, you're only to locate o_c1, and by the time you get back to your spot, the sun just looks normal again. o_c1 still appreciates the gesture.
You wander around looking for r_c and o_c1, but they're nowhere to be found! With some contemplation, you decide to enjoy the rings around the sun yourself. Hopefully r_c and o_c1 don't mind.

Although the rings around the sun are extremely cool, you have to squint to not burn your eyes from the sheer brightness it reflects off the snow. You assume r_c and o_c1 may appreciate the experience, but you would hate to hurt their eyes and decide to continue whatever you were doing before instead of fetching them.

intro_text: After several days of rainfall, temporary waterfalls have sprung up all over the mountainside. You stumble across a particularly beautiful one while on a walk, and consider taking r_c and o_c1 to see it.
decline_text: The waterfalls dry up as quickly as they appeared, and you miss the chance to show r_c and o_c1 any of them. Oh well. There'll be other chances.

success_outcomes.text: After a long day, you lead r_c and o_c1 to the waterfall. o_c1 gasps at the sight, especially after the sun breaks through the clouds and creates rainbows in the mist coming off of the water. The three of you find a rock to admire the view and you press against each other, purring, as the sun sets.

You lead o_c1 and r_c to a rock with a great view of the waterfall and lie there together, admiring it. After a bit, o_c1 glimpses water collecting at the base of the waterfall, and the three of you decide to take a look. You climb down to find a perfectly clear pool, and have fun splashing each other and searching for insects. You return to camp soaked and happy.

You... aren't really sure whether r_c and o_c1 will be interested. They've seen waterfalls before, after all! Still, you nervously lead them to the scene and are rewarded with their amazed gasps. The three of you relax on a nearby rock, watching water cascade from far above, and you feel warm when r_c and o_c1 agree that this is one of the most beautiful things they've ever seen.

You lead r_c and o_c1 to a rock with a great view of the waterfall and lounge in the sun together, sharing tongues. After a while, the three of you decide to venture closer. You carefully leap across the nearby boulders until you reach the veil of mist coming off of the waterfall, and you admire how the sun sparkles off of the droplets. The extra moisture means moss is growing on the surrounding stones, and r_c gently pulls off some flower-dappled pieces to give you and o_c1.

fail_outcomes.text: You lead r_c and o_c1 to the waterfall the day after you discover it, but find that it's already dried up. The three of you take a long walk through the territory instead, but you can't escape the feeling that you missed a chance to show r_c and o_c1 something special.

You lead r_c and o_c1 to the waterfall but find that it's grown significantly since you first visited. Instead of a gentle mist around the falls, water sprays in all directions, and you can't find anywhere with a good view where you won't get soaked. You give up on the attempt, though r_c and o_c1 assure you that they appreciate the thought.
